member.name: T:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.CompressionLevel
member.summary: Represents a compression level that can be applied to a connection.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.CompressionLevel.Level
member.summary:
The algorithm and level properties are used together in the following combinations.
Disabled—Compression is disabled if the level equals -1. The algorithm value is ignored when level equals -1.
Low compression—Compression is enabled at a low level if level equals 0 and algorithm equals 10.
Medium compression—Compression is enabled at a medium level if level equals 1 and algorithm equals 21.
High compression—Compression is enabled at a high level if level equals 2 and algorithm equals 31.
member.remarks: This value is a 0-based index into the list of compression algorithms that are shared by both the source and target servers. Typically, there are three levels of compression: 0 (Low), 1 (Medium) and 2 (High). A value of -1 means that compression is not used.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.CompressionLevel.Algorithm
member.summary:
The algorithm and level properties are used together in the following combinations.
Disabled—Compression is disabled if the level equals -1. The algorithm value is ignored when level equals -1.
Low compression—Compression is enabled at a low level if level equals 0 and algorithm equals 10.
Medium compression—Compression is enabled at a medium level if level equals 1 and algorithm equals 21.
High compression—Compression is enabled at a high level if level equals 2 and algorithm equals 31.
member.remarks: The specific compression algorithm that is used by the source server to compress the data and by the target server to decompress the data. This value doesn't have any inherent meaning; it is simply a value shared between servers.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.ConnectionStartParameters.Schedule
member.summary: This value represents the bandwidth, orphans, and verification schedule. These schedule settings will be applied to all connections that share the same route to the same target. Therefore, if a connection exists over the same route to the same target as the connection you are creating, any schedule changes will be applied to that connection as well.
member.remarks: Note that some schedule settings will get applied to all connections that share the same route to the same target. Therefore, if a connection exists over the same route to the same target as the connection you're creating, these schedule changes will be applied to that connection as well.

member.name: T:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.MirrorComparisonCriteria
member.summary: Specifies how to compare files during a difference mirror or when running a verification report.

member.summary: Double-Take will not perform any comparison between the files on the source and target.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.MirrorComparisonCriteria.Newer
member.summary: Double-Take will compare file attributes between the files on the source and target.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.MirrorComparisonCriteria.Checksum
member.summary: Double-Take will compare file attributes and file data between files on the source and target.

member.name: T:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.MirrorOperationOptions
member.summary: Specifies what to do when a verify mirror operation is performed.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.MirrorOperationOptions.None
member.summary: Double-Take will not mirror any files.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.MirrorOperationOptions.Synchronize
member.summary: Double-Take will mirror the files from the source to the target. If you use this property by itself, all files will be mirrored. If you use this property with CalculateDifferences, only the differences will be mirrored.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.MirrorOperationOptions.Report
member.summary: Double-Take will only report the differences found between the source protected data set and the replica on the target. You must use this option with CalculateDifferences in order for the differences to be reported.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.MirrorOperationOptions.CalculateDifferences
member.summary: The mirroring operation will calculate the differences between the source protected data and the replica on the target using MirrorComparisonCriteria.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.MirrorOperationOptions.CalculateSize
member.summary: The mirroring operation will calculate the size of the source protected data set.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.MirrorOperationOptions.ProcessOrphans
member.summary: The mirroring operation will process orphan files (files in the target path location that are not present on the source).

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.ScriptPointType.MirrorStart
member.summary: The script is executed when the target receives the first mirror operation. In the case of a difference mirror, this may be a long time after the mirror is started because the script does not start until the first different data is received on the target. If the data is synchronized and a difference mirror finds nothing to mirror, the script will not be executed.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.ScriptPointType.MirrorComplete
member.summary: The script is executed when a mirror is completed. Because the mirror statistics may indicate a mirror is at 99-100% when it is actually still processing (for example, if files were added after the job size was calculated, if there are alternate data streams, and so on), the script will not start until all of the mirror data has been completely processed on the target.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.ScriptPointType.MirrorStop
member.summary: The script is executed when a mirror is stopped, which may be caused by an auto-disconnect occurring while a mirror is running, the service is shutdown while a mirror is running, or if you stop a mirror manually.

member.summary: The target is in a good state.

member.summary: Mirroring is in progress.

member.summary: Mirroring was stopped. A remirror should be performed.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.TargetStates.OpDropped
member.summary: The target detected than an operation was dropped on the network. A remirror should be performed.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.TargetStates.Retrying
member.summary: The target is retrying a write operation.

member.summary: Writing to the target server has been paused by the user.

member.summary: Writing to the target server has been paused by the user.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.TargetStates.RestoreRequired
member.summary: The data on the source and target may not be synchronized because of a failover condition. This state will remain until a restore or remirror is completed.

member.summary: The connection has been established and replication is enabled, but the first replication operation has not been transmitted yet.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.TargetStates.SnapshotReverted
member.summary: The data on the source and target may not be synchronized because a snapshot was applied on the target. This state will remain until a restore or remirror is completed.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.TargetStates.FailoverMonitoring

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.TargetStates.TransactionsPending

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.TargetStates.GCReplicationComplete

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Connection.TargetStates.MarkedForDeletion

member.name: T:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.EngineJobType
member.summary: Defines possible types of an engine connection. These values are referred to as "job types" in the engine infrastructure; they should not be confused with the property.
member.remarks: Values of this enumeration should not be sent between client and server.
member.devdoc: This enumeration is marked as a data contract only so it can be persisted by the data contract serializer.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.EngineJobType.NormalJob
member.summary: This value is a files and folders connection.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.EngineJobType.ImageJob
member.summary: This value is a Double-Take DR protection connection.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.EngineJobType.RecoveryJob
member.summary: This value is a Double-Take DR recovery connection.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.EngineJobType.FullServerJob
member.summary: This value is a full server connection.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.EngineJobType.GeoClusterJob
member.summary: This value is a GeoCluster Replicate Disk resource connection.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.EngineJobType.MigrationJob
member.summary: This value is a Double-Take Move connection.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.EngineJobType.FullServerRevertJob
member.summary: This value is a full server reverse connection.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.EngineJobType.VraRecoveryJob
member.summary: This value is a full server to ESX or Hyper-V reverse connection.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.EngineJobType.VraMigrationJob
member.summary: This value is a full server to ESX or Hyper-V Double-Take Move connection.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.EngineJobType.DataOnlyOption
member.summary: This value is for a connection that is replicating data only.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.EngineJobType.VraJob
member.summary: This value is a full server to ESX or Hyper-V Double-Take Availability connection.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.EngineJobType.HyperVJob
member.summary: This value is a Hyper-V connection.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.EngineJobType.Win32MirrorOption
member.summary: This value is a connection that will override the server default and use the Win32 mirroring driver.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.EngineJobType.SourceConnectionResourceJob
member.summary: This value is a connection protecting a source cluster.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.EngineJobType.FullServerBackupJob
member.summary: This value is a full server reverse connection.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.EngineJobType.UvraJob
member.summary: This value is a full server to ESX appliance job.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.EngineJobType.NonClientAccessibleSnapshot
member.summary: This value indicates that snapshots created for this connections should not have the VSS_CTX_CLIENT_ACCESSIBLE context.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.EngineJobType.FFO
member.summary: This value is a full server job for Linux. This is not the real value for engine job type, but is for CreateConnectionAction to create a connection.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.EngineJobType.LVRA_JOB
member.summary: This value is a full server to ESX job for Linux. It is usually a connection to the local server (the source is same as the target) where the target drive is an iSCSI hosted by a Linux appliance. This is not the real value for engine job type, but is for CreateConnectionAction to create connection.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.EngineJobType.Invalid
member.summary: This value is an unknown connection.

member.name: T:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.ImageDeleteInfo
member.summary: Represents information about how to delete an image.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.ImageDeleteInfo.ImageId
member.summary: This value is the unique ID of the image you want to delete. The image contains the protected data from the source.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.ImageDeleteInfo.DeleteImage
member.summary: This value is true if the image should be deleted; otherwise it is false.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.ImageDeleteInfo.VhdDeleteAction
member.summary: This value represents which virtual disks should be deleted when the protection is deleted.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.ImageDeleteInfo.VhdsToDelete
member.summary: This value is a list of virtual disk files to delete. It is specified by the full path and file name to the virtual disk file.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.ImageDeleteInfo.ExtensionData
member.summary: Gets or sets the structure that contains extra data.
member.returns: An that contains data that is not recognized as belonging to the data contract.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.VhdDeleteActionType.KeepAll
member.summary: Do not delete any virtual disks. You will be able to reuse the virtual disks for another protection job.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.VhdDeleteActionType.DeleteAll
member.summary: Delete all virtual disks. You will not be able to reuse the virtual disks for another protection job.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.VhdDeleteActionType.UseVhdsToDelete
member.summary: Delete the virtual disks identified in VhdsToDelete. You will not be able to reuse the deleted virtual disks for another protection job.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.ImageVhdInfo.UseExistingVhd
member.summary: This value is true if an existing .vhd file should be used; otherwise, it is false. If you set this value to true, but no existing .vhd file exists, you will receive an error during job creation. If you set this value to false and an existing .vhd file exists, the file will be deleted and a new one will be created.

member.name: T:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.ActiveDirectoryFailoverOptions
member.summary: Used to indicate any Active Directory related options that should be set on a failover monitor.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.ActiveDirectoryFailoverOptions.None
member.summary: There are no Active Directory options applied.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.ActiveDirectoryFailoverOptions.FailoverHostName
member.summary: The host name of the source server should be moved to the Active Directory server object of the target when a failover occurs.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.ActiveDirectoryFailoverOptions.FailbackHostName
member.summary: The host name of the target server should be reinstated in the Active Directory server object of the target when failback occurs.

member.name: T:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailbackOption
member.summary: Used to specify the action to take after failing back an identity on the target server using .

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailbackOption.FailbackOnly
member.summary: Only the failback operation will occur. The command to resume monitoring or remove the monitor will not be issued.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailbackOption.RemoveMonitor
member.summary: After the failback operation completes, issue the command to remove the monitor.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailbackOption.ResumeMonitoring
member.summary: After failback operation completes, issue the command to resume monitoring.

member.name: T:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverDataAction
member.summary: Specifies the action to take on the queued or applied target data before failing over the source server identity to the target server.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverDataAction.Apply
member.summary: This value will apply the data in the target queue before starting failover.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverDataAction.Flush
member.summary: This value will discard the data in the target queue and start failover immediately.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverDataAction.Revert
member.summary: If the target data is in a bad state, this value will revert to the last good snapshot, if snapshots are available. If the target data is in a good state or no snapshots are available, this value will apply the data in the target queue and then failover.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverDataAction.Unknown
member.summary: The action is unknown.

member.name: T:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverIPAddressesOption
member.summary: Used to indicate which addresses should be applied to the target server when a failover operation is performed on a failover monitor.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverIPAddressesOption.Monitored
member.summary: Failover only the IP addresses that are being monitored.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverIPAddressesOption.All
member.summary: Failover all of the IP address on the source. server.

member.name: T:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverItems
member.summary: Used to indicate what identity items are failed over to the target when a failover operation is performed on a failover monitor.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverItems.None
member.summary: Nothing will be failed over.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverItems.IPAddresses
member.summary: The IP addresses specified by MonitorConfiguration.FailoverIPAddressesOption will be applied to the target during failover.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverItems.Name
member.summary: The NetBIOS name of the source server will be applied to the target during failover.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverItems.Shares
member.summary: Shares included in the source workload will be added to the target during failover.

member.name: T:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverProcessingOptions
member.summary: Used to specify how the failover is processed.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverProcessingOptions.None
member.summary: This value resets the flags so no failover processing options will be used.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverProcessingOptions.UserInterventionRequired
member.summary: The user must manually initiate failover when a failover condition is met.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverProcessingOptions.UseShareFile
member.summary: When failing over file shares, the persisted share file on the target should be used to create the shares on the target. Without this value, the target will attempt to obtain the shares from the source during failover, however, if the source is unavailable, no shares will be created on the target.

member.name: T:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverReplaceActions
member.summary: Used to indicate what identity items are to be replaced on the target with the identity items from the source.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverReplaceActions.Address
member.summary: The IP addresses on the target will be replaced by the IP address from the source during failover.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverReplaceActions.Name
member.summary: The NetBIOS name of the target will be replaced by the NetBIOS name from the source during failover.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverReplaceActions.None
member.summary: This value resets the flags so no failover replace actions will be used.

member.name: T:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverScriptConfiguration
member.summary: Used to specify the paths of scripts to be run at different stages of the failover and failback operations. The script arguments may also be specified with this data contract.

member.summary: This value is the full path and file name of the script located on the target and to be run on the target after failback.
member.remarks: This script is run on the target machine and the path must be a path to a script on the target machine.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverScriptConfiguration.PostFailbackScriptArgs
member.summary: This value is the comma-separated arguments for PostFailbackScript.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.Monitor.FailoverScriptConfiguration.PostFailoverScript
member.summary: This value is the full path and file name of the script located on the target and to be run on the target after failover.

member.summary: This value is the full path and file name of the script located on the target and to be run on the target before failover.

member.name: T:DoubleTake.Core.Contract.FullServerJobType
member.summary:
This enum is used during System State verification as well as rule generation of all full server job types. It is basically a wrapper for the SSMCLI::JobType enum class. It tells system state which rules and transform paths to generate, and/or validators to run. This has been around forever so the names are a little funky and don't really equate to the current job names. I have included what the current jobs should be using. For additional information, see Ed or Louie.
Validation: -Move Server Migration job should use MoveServerMigration -All others should use FullServerProtection
Rules and transforms: -Any job that is using a snapshot for recovery/failover/failback should use SnapshotMirror -A Full Server Failover job that has a DR image repository server as it's source should use ImageRepositoryFailover -All others should use FullServerProtection

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.CoreQualificationResults.DefaultAllToOneBasePath
member.summary: This value sets the default base path for the all to one path mapping, which configures the source replica data to be stored on a single volume on the target. The default is \source_name\volume_name. If you are protecting multiple volumes on the source, each volume would be stored on the same volume on the target. For example, C:\data and D:\files for the source Alpha would be stored in D:\alpha\C and D:\alpha\D, respectively.

member.summary: Represents the data needed to fully reconstitute a files-and-folders job in it's last known state.

member.summary: Gets or sets the persisted state of the job.
member.value: The persisted state of the job.
member.remarks:
Possible values for this property:
Value Description
None No state had been determined due to failed initialization.
Stopped The job was in a stopped state.
Protecting The job was in a protecting state.
Restoring The job was restoring.
Failed The job was in a failed state.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.FilesAndFolders.FilesAndFoldersPersistedState.FailedSubState
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the sub-state when the property is Failed.
member.value: The sub-state when the property is Failed.
member.remarks:
Possible values for this property:
Value Description
FailedOver The job is in a failed-over state which means that the target is standing in for the source.
FailedBack The target is no longer standing in for the source

member.name: T:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.JobAction
member.summary: Represents an action recently reported by a job.
member.remarks: Naturally, error information is logged for a job in the Windows event log and other locations. This class represents an action or error in a format that is convenient for displaying in the user interface.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.JobAction.Id
member.summary: This value is the unique ID of the action.
member.value: The unique identifier of this action.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.JobAction.Status
member.summary: This value represents the status of the action.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.JobAction.TitleId
member.summary: This value is the title ID for the action. This value can be used to look up a title associated with this action.
member.value: The title id for this action.

member.summary: This value is the title format parameters for the action.
member.value: The title format parameters for this action.

member.summary: This value is the message ID for the action. This value can be used to look up a message associated with this action.
member.value: The message id for this action.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.JobAction.MessageFormatParameters
member.summary: This value is the message format parameters.
member.value: The message format parameters for this action.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.JobAction.ErrorCode
member.summary: This value is the error code associated with the action.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.JobAction.ExceptionMessage
member.summary: This value is a message from the underlying exception. The message stored in this property should not be displayed in the user interface, as it may not be available in the language used by the interface. This property should only be used for internal troubleshooting, and as a measure of last resort in the event of a completely unexpected error.
member.remarks: Job implementations should define specific messages for all known errors that can occur during the lifetime of a job. The message stored in this property should not be displayed in the user interface, as it may not be available in the language used by the console. This property should only be used for internal troubleshooting, and as measure of last resort in the event of an completely unexpected error.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.JobAction.Timestamp
member.summary: This value is the time when the action occurred.
member.value: The timestamp when this action occurred.

member.summary: This value is the duration of the action.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.JobAction.RequestingUserName
member.summary: This value is the name of the user that requested the action.
member.value: The name of the user that requested this action.

member.summary: Gets or sets the structure that contains extra data.

member.name: T:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.JobInfo
member.summary: Represents a job.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.JobInfo.Id
member.summary: This value is the unique ID for the job.
member.value: The unique identifier of this job.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.JobInfo.JobType
member.summary:
This value is the type of job.
Specify the type of job from the following list.
ClusterAwareDTHV—Cluster-aware agentless Hyper-V job
ClusterAwareExchange—Cluster-aware Exchange job
ClusterAwareFilesAndFolders—Cluster-aware files and folders job
ClusterAwareHV2V—Cluster-aware virtual to Hyper-V job
ClusterAwareMultiSelectDthv—Cluster-aware agentless Hyper-V job
ClusterAwareSql—Cluster-aware SQL job
DataOnlyImageProtection—DR data protection job
DataOnlyImageRecovery—DR data recovery job
Diagnostics—Throughput Diagnostic Utility job
DTHV—Agentless Hyper-V job
Exchange—Exchange job
FilesAndFolders—Files and folders job
FullServerFailover—Full server job
FullServerImageProtection—DR full server protection job
FullServerImageRecovery—DR full server recovery job
Legacy—GeoCluster jobs
LinuxFullServerFailover—Full server for Linux job
Lvra—Full server to ESX appliance job
MoveDataOnlyMigration—Data migration job
MoveServerMigration—Full server migration job
MultiSelectDTHV—Agentless Hyper-V job
OrphanedConnection—Old, orphaned connection (if Double-Take was uninstalled and then reinstalled on a target server or possibly after failover, depending on the state of your servers before failover occurred)
SQL—SQL job
UnmanagedConnection—Double-Take versions 5.2.x and earlier
UVRA—Double-Take version 7.0.1 or earler full server to ESX appliance job
V2V—V to ESX or V to Hyper-V job
VRA—Full server to ESX or full server to Hyper-V job
VraMove—Full server to ESX migration or full server to Hyper-V migration job

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.JobInfo.Managed
member.summary: This value is true if the job is managed; otherwise, it is false. This property is intended to be used by transitional implementations of jobs that want to allow their jobs to be visible to the job manager, but will be responsible for creating those jobs and managing their lifetime.
member.value: if this job is managed; otherwise, .
member.remarks: This property is intended to be used by transitional implementations of jobs that want to allow their jobs to be visible to the job manager, but will be responsible for creating those jobs and managing their lifetime. Typically, jobs who have this property set to will be added to the job manager using the method.

member.name: T:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.JobStatus
member.summary: Represents the current status of a job.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.JobStatus.EmptyPermillageComplete
member.summary: Defines the value for that will prevent the percentage from being displayed in the UI.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.JobStatus.Health
member.summary: This value represents the high level health of the job.
member.remarks: Job health is an at-a-glance indication of whether the job is working correctly. Users can be assured that a job whose health is is working properly, while a job whose health is should be more closely monitored, and a job whose health is requires immediate attention.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.JobStatus.HighLevelState
member.summary: This value represents high level job states. High level states typically map to phases of the job's overall lifecycle, like mirroring or failing over. Jobs will pass through various high level states during their lifetime, and the types of high level states are usually shared between jobs, regardless of job type.
member.value: The high level state of this job.
member.remarks: High level states of a job typically map to phases of the job's overall lifecycle. Examples include "mirroring", "replicating", "failing over", etc. Jobs will pass through various high level states during their lifetime, and the types of high level states are usually shared between jobs, regardless of the job's purpose.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.JobStatus.LowLevelState
member.summary: This value is a low level job state. Low level states typically map to individual steps the job is performing at any given time, like attaching virtual disks or updating DNS. Low level states provide detailed information about a job's current state or action and will vary between different job types.
member.value: The low level state of this job.
member.remarks: Low level states of a job typically map to individual steps the job is performing at any given time. Examples include "attaching virtual disks", "system state processing", "updating DNS", etc. Low level state provides detailed information about what's going on with the job right now, and will widely vary between jobs with different purpose.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.JobStatus.ExtendedLowLevelStates
member.summary: This value represents additional information about the low level job state.
member.value: The low level states of this job.
member.remarks: Additional information about the low level state.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.JobStatus.TargetState
member.summary: This value is derived from TargetStates. Information from the connection is distilled into a string key which is sent to the client for display.
member.value: The state of the data on the target server.
member.remarks: Target state is derived from a number values. Information from the connection is distilled into a string key which is sent to the client for display.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.JobStatus.PermillageComplete
member.summary: This value is the percentage of the current activity for that job that is complete. To display a percentage string for an arbitrary activity, jobs can provide a value for this property, and that value will be formatted and displayed in the client. To remove the display of the percentage, set this property to zero.
member.value: The permillage complete of the current activity of this job.
member.remarks: To display a "percent complete" string for an arbitrary activity, jobs can provide a value for this property, and that value will be formatted and displayed in the console. To remove the display of the percentage, set this property to zero.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Jobs.Contract.RecommendedJobOptions.JobQualificationResults
member.summary: This value represents the job qualification results which are other possible job options, in addition to those that are strictly recommended. For example, JobOptions.CoreConnectionOptions. TargetAddress may be the recommended address, but JobQualificationResults.CoreQualificationResults.TargetIPAddresses may include other IP addresses on the server.
member.remarks: The job qualification results are used to communicate other possible option for a job, outside of the options that are strictly recommended. For example, the property may recommend a specific IP address as the target route, but the property may include the other IP addresses on the server.

member.summary: Indicates that the monitor has been started at least once and is now stopped.

member.summary: Indicates that the monitor is actively monitoring and there have not been any misses.

member.summary: Indicates that the monitor is running and the current number of misses is greater than zero.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Monitoring.Contract.MonitorState.Triggering
member.summary: Indicates that the monitor is running, the current number of misses equals the value specified in MissesAllowed and the triggered actions are currently being executing.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Monitoring.Contract.MonitorState.Triggered
member.summary: Indicates that the monitor is running, the current number of misses equals the value specified in MissesAllowed and the triggered actions have been executed.

member.name: T:DoubleTake.Virtualization.Contract.BootProcessingTypes
member.summary: These are the types of boot processing we can perform and are the constants used to fill the BootProcessingOptions.BootProcessingType field.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Virtualization.Contract.BootProcessingTypes.Full
member.summary: Indicates that the full boot processing should occur, including device driver injection and the registry fixups required to make the network adapters have the desired IP addresses.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Virtualization.Contract.BootProcessingTypes.SkipDeviceDriverInjection
member.summary: Indicates that the drive is mostly correct, it just needs adjusted for the fact that the drive volumes aren't the same. We will skip the device driver injection and network adapter fixups. We do still do WANFailover things, domain controller adjustments and things like that.

member.name: T:DoubleTake.Virtualization.Contract.PartitionInitializationInfo
member.summary: This class describes what a partition on the disk looks like and how it is formatted.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Virtualization.Contract.PartitionInitializationInfo.PartitionType
member.summary: One of the partition types from the PartitionTypes class

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Virtualization.Contract.PartitionInitializationInfo.Size
member.summary: The size in Megabytes of the partition. If the size is 0 then it will consume the rest of the space.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Virtualization.Contract.PartitionInitializationInfo.Offset
member.summary: The offset, in kilobytes, at which the partition is created. If offset is 0, the partition will start at the beginning of the first free space on the disk that is large enough to hold the new partition.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Virtualization.Contract.PartitionInitializationInfo.Align
member.summary: The partition offset will be a multiple of this value. If the Offset value is given, it will be round to the closest multiple of this value.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Virtualization.Contract.PartitionInitializationInfo.Active
member.summary: Should the partition be made active.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Virtualization.Contract.PartitionInitializationInfo.ShouldFormatPartition
member.summary: Indicates whether the partition should be formatted.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Virtualization.Contract.PartitionInitializationInfo.FileSystemType
member.summary: The file system type such as NTFS, RFS. See FileSystemTypes class. If null, RECOMMENDED is used.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Virtualization.Contract.PartitionInitializationInfo.Label
member.summary: The string to be used as the label of the volume. This is optional.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Virtualization.Contract.PartitionInitializationInfo.QuickFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether we should use a "quick" format.
member.value: true if Quick format is desired; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Virtualization.Contract.PartitionInitializationInfo.ShouldCreateMountPointDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether InitializeDisk should create mount point directory or not.
member.value: true if InitializeDisk should create mount point directory; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Virtualization.Contract.PartitionInitializationInfo.MountPoint
member.summary: Where you want the partition mounted. (If the mountpoint looks like a {driveletter}: We will attempt to assign that drive letter to the volume.

member.summary: Used when initialize the Linux disk. Determine whether this partition is boot.

member.summary: Used when initialize the Linux disk.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Virtualization.Contract.VRA.V2VVirtualMachine.DiskFormat
member.summary:
This value is the disk format.
Dynamic—Use this value for ESX thin disks and for Hyper-V dynamic disks.
Fixed—Use this value for ESX thick disks and for Hyper-V fixed disks.
Flat Disk—Use this value for ESX flat disks. This type is not supported on Hyper-V.

member.name: F:DoubleTake.Virtualization.Contract.VHDInfo.Type
member.summary:
This value is the disk type.
0-This value is an unknown disk type.
2-This value is a fixed disk.
3-This value is a dynamic disk.
4-This value is a differencing disk.
5-This value is a thick disk.
6-This value is a thin disk.
7-This value is a flat disk.

member.summary: This value is the virtual NIC.
member.value: The type of the virtual nic.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Virtualization.Contract.VirtualNetworkInterfaceInfo.VLAN_ID
member.summary: Gets or sets the replica's VLan ID.
member.value: The replica's VLan ID. Possible values: -1 - indicates that the vlan should not be set at failover time and the service supports setting it. 0 - indicates that the server does not support setting the vlan id at failover time. (1 - 4095) - indicates that the vlan for this nic should be set at failover time. all other values are not supported.

member.name: P:DoubleTake.Virtualization.Contract.VirtualNetworkInterfaceInfo.VLAN_ID_TestFailover
member.summary: Gets or sets the replica's test failover VLan ID.
member.value: The replica's VLan ID during test failover. Possible values: -1 - indicates that the vlan should not be set at failover time and the service supports setting it. 0 - indicates that the server does not support setting the vlan id at failover time. (1 - 4095) - indicates that the vlan for this nic should be set at failover time. all other values are not supported.
